text: Anna-Rose Levinson (8 January 1939 - 13 May 2015) was a German zoologist and entomologist. She worked at the Max Planck Institute for Behavioral Physiology from 1971 and the Max Planck Institute for Ornithology from 2004. Levinson was born in Tel Aviv, Israel and graduated from the University of Jerusalem in 1966. She later moved to Germany, living in Starnberg, Bavaria. She was married to Hermann Levinson until his death in November 2013. Levinson died on 13 May 2015, aged 76. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2015 deaths Category:German biologists Category:Israeli biologists Category:Jewish German academics Category:Jewish German scientists Category:People from Bavaria Category:Scientists from Tel Aviv Category:German zoologists Category:Entomologists
title: Anna Levinson
